meanings.sent1: Photons are tiny particles of light.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photons to understand light better.
meanings.sent3: Why did the photon bring a flashlight to the party? To lighten up the mood!
meanings.sent4: In the dark room, the photons danced like fireflies in the night.
meanings.sent5: The photons in the sky painted a beautiful rainbow of colors.

meanings.definition: A particle representing a quantum of light or other electromagnetic radiation.
meanings.sent1: When you turn on a lamp, photons are emitted.
meanings.sent2: Photons travel at the speed of light.
meanings.sent3: The photon told the electron, 'You light up my world!'
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a burst of photons illuminating the room.
meanings.sent5: The photons bounced off the mirror, creating a dazzling display of reflections.
